page.title: 01WHITTONSTALL AND NEWLANDS
page.content: {THE VILLAGE OF WHITTONSTALL STANDS 750FEET ABOVE SEALEVEL ON THE OLD ROMAN ROAD KNOWN AS DERE STREET.HISTORICALLY IT HAS ALWAYS BEEN CONNECTED WITH THE VILLAGE OF NEWLANDS WHICH LIES 2MILES SOUTH.THE LAND AROUND THE VILLAGES IS MAINLY ARABLE AND GRAZING LAND AND A LARGE NUMBER OF THE INHABITANTS OF BOTH VILLAGES ARE CONNECTED WITH THIS EITHER DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY.THE TOTAL POPULATION OF BOTH VILLAGES IS 108. WHITTONSTLL VILLAGE IS VERY EXPOSED AND IS VERY COLD IN WINTER OFTEN BEING CUT OFF FOR SOME HOURS OR MORE AND IS ALWAYS VERY WINDY.BECAUSE OF ITS EXPOSED AND ISOLATED POSITION WHITTONSTALL DID NOT HAVE PIPED WATER OR ELECTRICTY UNTIL1953.WATER WAS FETCHED FROM THE VILLAGE PUMP UNTIL THAT TIME AND CALOR GAAS USED IN THE HOUSES.
